claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

evidence.quote: The paper investigates whether intratumoral delivery of an mRNA vaccine can create an interferon-rich inflammatory state that improves sensitivity to anti-PD-L1 therapy.
Type I interferon response score (normalized units): 3.1
Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.

claims.caveat: The mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase after mRNA vaccination.

evidence.quote: Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome: 62.3%
Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome: 40.6%
Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase.

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells.

evidence.quote: Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome: 40.6%
A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells.

claims.caveat: The expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape was demonstrated in preclinical models but may not directly translate to all human tumor types.

claims.claim: PD-L1 pathway activity increases, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade.

evidence.quote: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue: 2.4x
PD-L1 pathway activity also increases, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade.

claims.caveat: Increased PD-L1 expression was observed but the clinical benefit depends on proper timing and patient selection.

claims.claim: Combined intratumoral mRNA vaccine and anti-PD-L1 therapy improves tumor control in mice.

evidence.quote: Preclinical arm: multiple murine tumor models with intratumoral mRNA vaccine and anti-PD-L1 combinations.
Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors due to differences in immunology and tumor microenvironment.

claims.claim: Retrospective human cohort analysis shows vaccinated patients had improved survival under ICI treatment.

evidence.quote: Human retrospective metastatic cohort: 130 patients total
Retrospective human survival comparison p-value: p=0.01

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely and vaccination timing varied across patients.
